therefore cannot much amiss insert example like work hath much esteemed family reader good reader thou hereon lookes ••• g pe • h abandon mynde haultye may proved y averde though thou think faultye forget basenesse thy byrthe best condem stauntons may compare thee thou canst therefore better conclude rest ryse leest thou rise fall againe meanes enterprise petigrewe go shew thy self truth lurkes darke supervysores attentyve marke stauntons two chevron fox crest dysneys three flower de li upon fesse lyon passant gardant crest stauntons petygrewe champion cheefe warlike wight stauntons stocke pryme thy sequele must blase petigrewe define though haroldes noble sorte thy arm pende vaine yet somethinge war • writte book toumbes shew plaine first sir manger staunton knight wylliam came realme one monarche conquer winne time mauger knight thrughe feat arm sheeld marcyall prowes valeant wanne feelde belveor castle houlde stauntones tour highte strongest forte front hiest men fighte unto forte force flagge stauntons stocke must sticke defende foe could kicke lodgeinge large turritte time ease may command night day man displease therefore stauntons mannor nowe whiche staunton doth stande belveor castle helde tenure lande staunton knight gott sure wife one emme worthy fame also son knighted mauger name whiche last syr mauger tooke wife beautrix sage wise valeant father every enterprise whiche lady beautrix daughter lord belveor castle vale tombes armes accorde whiche two sir knight crosslegged lieth male armoure fine theire superscription worne away theire deathes without time yet warlike wightes helmes heades stauntons church lie soules doubt noble actes ascende sky hie death last knight got two son william iohn also manhood strengthe marre pasture belveor lorde said belongd northmanton trulie knight seasde die thereof demaine fee sir william staunton knight next dame athlin wife sir geoffrey staunton knight heire voide vice strife sir henrie brother gave himselfe learne came unto man state could lawes discerne went forward still profited muche know ynnes courte counsailer serjeant lawe processe tyme indeede judge came bee common benche westminster highe degree baron wise great wealthe built scholers gaine sainct michael house cambridge towne good learninge attaine deed done eighteenth yeare second edwarde king one thousande three hundred twenty foure pray singe said house stauntons may send student placed founder hath confirmed cannot defaced lord baron yssue cannot remember wife body tombed death cutt life sir william father tombed sure stauntons church olde hath engraved upon stone verbatim behoulde hic jacet wilelmus de staunton mile filius maugeri de eâdem militis qui obiit 6 ultimo maii cujus animae propitietur deus amen sir geffrey tooke dame alce wife four son beget willyam richarde robert iohn also margaret robert iohn persones staunton aforesaide margret married trickingham cannot denaide robert chauncell lithe staunton seene superscription extant theis wordes weene hic jacet robertus quondam rector ecclesiae de staunto et frater wilelmi staunton de eadem militis qui obiit nonis kalend maii anno domini 1329 cujus animae propitietur deus iohn brother like sorte lie tumbled stone superscription may seene gone hic jacet johannes quondam rector ecclesiae de staunton filius galfridi staunton de eadem militis anno domini sir gefrey one thousand also two hundred fifty reade addinge seven thereto rated prior haverholme neighbour dead gone many cattell put marre one unto lord alwais certaine cheefe lue olde time calld marre pennyes day due stauntons also likewise common therein yet still willowes cutt fish take thing sir willyam sir gefreys heire isbell spouse sister sir raph kerketon werton knight auncient house rafe unto dame isbell gave landes greate rent saye kilvington wilberdston frankemarriage aye sir wilyam dame isbell son name sir wilyam staunton knight grave sadd sir wilyam father hathe owne tombe well writte set worde worde arm graved hic jacet wilelmus de staunton mile filius galfridi de eâdem militis qui obiit nonis maii anno domini 1326 cujus animae propitietur deus last sir wilyam ioane wife sonnes foure indeede gefrey iohn simon also thomas reede iohn seconde sonne finde yssue iohn aright devonshire man courage stoute worthy knight symon learned clerke staunton parson life callinge coequal menne agree persnage grounde builded much large house office gatehouse semely charge simon ended done workes coste left past away labour loste pasport plaine there writte upon tombe great rewarde man hath done hic jacet magister simon rector ecclesiae de staunton et frater galfridi de eâdem militis qui aedificavit rectoriam de staunton obiit idus septembris anno domini 1346 cujus animae propitietur deus amen last sir wilyam wedded ioane beauty faire unity lived longe sir gefrey heire wilyam died year christ one thousand gesse three hundred fortie addinge one one yeare lesse tumulo est animam super aethera vexit rex deus omnipotens arx cornu petra piorum det deus astriferum mecum te scandere coelum obiit 2 novemb dom 1585 aetatis suae 36 edovardus greausus quondam verbi domini praeco ecclesia novarcensi quoque terra tegit tandem suavissime smithe os sub hoc tumulo recubant super aethera fertur spiritus ut tecum coelesti pace fruatur vtque tibi fuerim sincero junctus amore tam tibi vicinum placuit mihi smithe sepulcrum mi seele vale ne sim tibi causa doloris johannes seelus quis mihi fraena dabit luctus compescere tantos quantos quam chari mors dira ministrat upon marble within alabaster wall henrico trewmanno viro faeliciter docto hujus ecclesiae praesuli vigilantissimo quis hunc quaesivit angulum quaeris veritatis angelus quis hîc conditus est viator rogas sale melle conditus ipse sal melos verus homo veri dei αψευδης αγγελιωτης absit venalis gloria colossis mendax marmor non adblandiente verborum lapidumve strue illum vel vivum vel mortuum ementiemur cum sibi sculpta laus et doctum existit monumentumhen trewman hic sydus eluxit inter sydera jam coronatus dum desideriis syderatos relinquens no coelicolis triumphat sacer mysta insanis populi turbis saeculorum saevis turbinibus inturbatus insolitis mundi procellosis fluctibus non minus solito serenus sic cautus ipsius gubernator tranquillo fatalis naufragii speculator tutu et clarior obscuritate temporum factus stelliferi claritate olympi gaudes lampas fulgens quid quaeris amplius regi à sacris coelestis orator capellanus populo à mysteriis veritatis assertor minister amicis à sacro foedere sanctissimus cultor coeli jam municeps eloquio casti sermonis joci consuetudine generosihonesti flores fructus et rerum veritate verborum varittate facundus omnibus facundusmellifluus artisex sic lucidissimis elegantiarum gemmis ornatum et divino entheatum pectus fervore plusquam humana sapuit mirantes que omnes attonuit audientium choros foelicitatem quam vivendo dedit abstulit abeundo sic utilis terris sic dulcis coelo nusquam non integer παναληθης charissimi soceri memoriae piè consulens triste hoc sui obsequii ministerium posuit l jenison aetatis tevery siste lege morae pretium erit scire quis hic situs est qui sibi virtutis incrementum posteris ad familiae ornamentum patriae ad boni publici emolumentum faeliciter natus est qui tribunalis provincia sua moderator adeo prudens ut apud summos juris oraculum tantus aequi justiciae patronus fuit ut apud infimos pauperum tutelare numen audierit qui amicitiis fidem sodalitiis humanitatem moribus integritatem sanctissimè coluit liberalis semper hospes idemque prudens pater familias g • rvasius tevery armig nobilissima staplefordorum paschallorum creveceurorum prole haeres majoribus ut vitâ quâ postridie idus augusti anno domini 1639 aetatis verò 65 piè defunctus est ita morte succedens inter avorum umbra hic placidè conquiescit cujus sacris manibus debitae memoriae hoc tantis virtutibus impar monumentum multas inter lachrymas posuit dicavit anna vidua ejus moestissima quae ex veteri prosapiâ ashbyorum de quenby agro leicestrensi oriunda ei peperit unicum filiolum tres filias johannem primo aetatis germine elizabetham ipso flore satis immaturè praereptam mariam briano palmes armig enuptam annam utramque haeredem ejus superstitem inscription remember made ingenious leicestrensi equitis aurati filiae quae cum optimis naturae dotibus ex instinctu praedita tum virtutibus parentum curâ diligentia que summum quasi ad vestigium aucta quintum vicesimum aetatis annum agens johanni lockeo regiensi sedibus hertfordianis generoso nupta est quo cum ut piissime conjunctissime que suum uxoris per tres annos conjugale munus obiit serum sibi cita suis carnem hic depositura se ad plureis penetravit quarto idus septembris anno verbi incarnati 1633 cui officii amoris ergo monumentum hoc maritus ille moestissimus extruxit eja age siste locum tenet hunc matrona sacratum clara venusta pudens religiosa gravis ergo jacent charitas pieta que sed astra vicissim hac poterant aliâ non reperire viâ margarita jacet non annis dempta sed anni vt spectes animum dant obiisse senem inscription arm locko saunders impaled viz arg bend two waterbougets sable locko party per chevron sab arg three elephant head erased counterchanged saunders another tomb second wife impaled arm locko gules fesse arg three crescent many escallop azure elli grantham inscription ad memoriam sempiternam janae suae dom thomae elisio de granthamia finibus lincolniensibus equiti aurato unique à conciliis domino regi provincia boreali minoris natu filiae morum pariter formae spectabilis venustate sibi que post quadrennium interrupti foelicissimi conjugii paribus auspiciis secundi torus matrimonium collocatae cui ut ferè quae sunt cordi maximè vertente biennio nottinghamie accidit humanitus fato praematuro cedere calendis sextilibus annosque jam haud uno viginti amplius habenti ad humanae salutis dc xxxix johannes lockeus hertfordiensis de rigia generosus monumentum hoc desiderii conjunctionis ergo consecravit sanctissimaeque conjugi superstes dissidium luctuosus deflet elysia de gente redux jana sed ebeu cur haec lux quae dat gaudia curta daret ne coelum invidiae quanquam juvenis que vigens que serior optarim viseret umbra polo image chara diem melior ne que munus obivit reddita que elysiis orta que dignatuis another monument p viri apprime venerabilis georgii cote bonarum artium ferè omnium thesaurarii principis artis instar omnium theologiae cimeliarchi gregis egregii custodis denique ut ingenii ut vitae cultum instituerint omnibus merito exemplaris cujus pectus pietatis sacrarium fuêre cujus lingua spiritus tuba fuêre cujus manus christi erogatrix fuêre cujus domus religionis schol • fuêre cujus vita morum consura fuêre qui ut annos quatuor viginti summa fide summaque diligentia curam hujus ecclesiae sustinuerat exantlato labore ad patriam rediturus mortale quod erat servandum heic deposuit caetera perennier luctum amicis sui ingens desiderium suis adeo que bonis omnibus relinquens è corporis evolavit vinculis iii cal decemb anno post natum christum mdcxl aetatis autem suae liii cui nepos ejus samuel cote hoc pii doloris perpetuum juxta patrui meritorum suisque superstitis amoris moerenti moerens monumentum p diver latine verse
